page.title: 01General Description
page.content: Except for the South Western corner of the area,where the land rises to the North and South from the River Ray,the land is flat at about 60 metres above sea level.The River Ray runs through the area from NE to SW and flows into the Cherwell over a weir at Islip.The area takes in part of Otmoor (see page 3) the rest being mainly farmland mostly under cereals.There are three villages in the area.Islip with a population of about 600,Noke with a population of about 120,and Oddington with about 70.(Figures based on electoral rolls.)A footpath known as the Oxfordshire Way runs through the area from North to South through Islip where it turns SE to Noke.Although much of Otmoor has been drained,the area is still subject to flooding in heavy rain.
